alert.note: Alert for Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 05 at 2:31AM PST until March 05 at 8:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Owens Valley, mainly south of Bishop. * WHEN...Through 8 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Strong and sudden crosswinds along Highway 395 will be a danger to high-profile vehicles. Winds could blow around unsecured objects, a few power outages may result, and areas of blowing dust may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very strong crosswinds along parts of Highway 395 could result in blow overs, especially from Independence and south to Ridgecrest. Observations near the 395 corridor south of the county line have gusted over 70 mph this morning. High profile vehicles will need to be extremely cautious.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
